abstract: The market was not kind to young companies trying to go public this week. | T-Mobile’s bid for MetroPCS could spark some rival offers, the Deal Professor writes. | Morgan Stanley’s chief executive, James Gorman, seems to agree with shareholders’ concerns about pay. | Julian Robertson, the founder of Tiger Management, celebrated his 80th birthday in style.

lead_paragraph: The I.P.O. Blues  |  The market was not kind to young companies trying to go public this week. The latest casualty came on Thursday, when Dave & Buster’s Entertainment, the restaurant-and-arcade chain, withdrew plans for an I.P.O. The chief executive, Steve King, cited the usual reasons: “current market conditions are not optimal.”
